title: Teaching
text:
Narrative reviews gather evidence but lack empirical synthesis. Meta-analysis quantitatively combines effect sizes from multiple studies addressing similar hypotheses, revealing general patterns objectively. Despite limitations (file drawer problem, publication quality variations), meta-analysis powerfully identifies patterns in data-rich disciplines like agriculture, ecology, psychology, medicine, and education where large, under-analyzed datasets abound.




Senanayaka Mudiyanselage, P., Lindsey, L., Oladipupo, S.O. , 2025. Does Growing Latitude Influence Soybean Seed Critical Amino Acid Content? A Meta-Analysis. Agric. Environ. Lett

underlined = Student in class







Acquaint construction engineers with the incredible biological diversity found on Planet Earth using insects as examples and biological models. Management of buildings against attacking and inhabiting insects, animals, and fungi will be covered.

title: Contact
text:
Contact
Get in Touch with Us Seun Oladipupo Assistant Professor, Urban Entomology Oladipupo.7@osu

title: # The Oladipupo Lab
text:
Urban Entolomogy
We are broadly interested in developing sustainable urban pest management solutions through interdisciplinary research. Our lab uses diverse approaches – biotechnology, biochemistry, and bioinformatics – to understand host-microbe interactions and the functional roles of microbiomes in urban insect pests. Additionally, we integrate socioeconomic research on pest prevalence to create comprehensive, eco-friendly management strategies.

title: # The Oladipupo Lab
text:
Some areas of focus are:

Investigating socioeconomic drivers of urban pest prevalence
Understanding microbiome influence on urban pest life history traits
Developing sustainable pest control strategies
Creating translational tools for real-world applications

title: # The Oladipupo Lab
text:
The Oladipupo Lab News

August x, 2025: Our paper, Deubiquitylases and Nucleases in Bacterial Symbiont-induced Cytoplasmic Incompatibility, got accepted in Biochemical Society Transactions.
July 24, 2025: Manuscript from Meta-Analysis Class by Prabath Mudiyanselage, Does Growing Latitude Influence Soybean Seed Critical Amino Acid Content? A Meta-Analysis was accepted in Agricultural and Environmental Letters.
Our featured story, Don’t let bed bugs crash your vacation, was the number one headline for Thursday, July 24, 2025. Read more on the CFAES page.
June 02, 2025: Undergraduates Nina Brown and Ashely Hamby join the lab to work on [Mapping Inequities Seed Grant] (https://ugresearch.osu.edu/research-postings/mapping-inequities-data-driven-approach-understanding-and-combating-bed-bug).
May 30, 2025: Visiting Scholar, Damilola Gbore, joins Cambridge University. Best wishes, Damilola!
May 2, 2025: Mapping Inequities Seed Grant Awarded.
April 17, 2025: Incoming graduate student, Abdulafeez Hamzat, awarded a University Fellowship to support his Master’s work.
March 12, 2025: Seun gave a Wooster Science Café Talk titled The Science of the Unseen.
March 10, 2025: Our collaborative work on Origins of Cin is available on BioRxiv
March 06, 2025: Seun Cockroach Control at Structural and Vertebrate Pest Webinar.
January 06, 2025: Visiting Scholar, Damilola Gbore, joins our lab.
August 15, 2024: Day 1: The Oladipupo Lab door opened at The Ohio State University.
